verses.text: But Solomon was building his own house thirteen years, and he finished all his house.

He built also the house of the forest of Lebanon; the length thereof \add was\add* an hundred cubits, and the breadth thereof fifty cubits, and the height thereof thirty cubits, upon four rows of cedar pillars, with cedar beams upon the pillars.
And \add it was\add* covered with cedar above upon the beams, that \add lay\add* on forty five pillars, fifteen \add in\add* a row.
And \add there were\add* windows \add in\add* three rows, and light \add was\add* against light \add in\add* three ranks.
And all the doors and posts \add were\add* square, \add with the\add* windows: and light \add was\add* against light \add in\add* three ranks.

And he made a porch of pillars; the length thereof \add was\add* fifty cubits, and the breadth thereof thirty cubits: and the porch \add was\add* before them: and \add the other\add* pillars and the thick beam \add were\add* before them.
Then he made a porch for the throne where he might judge, \add even\add* the porch of judgment: and \add it was\add* covered with cedar from one side of the floor to the other.

And his house where he dwelt \add had\add* another court within the porch, \add which\add* was of the like work. Solomon made also a house for Pharaoh’s daughter, whom he had taken \add to wife\add*, like unto this porch.

All these \add were of\add* costly stones, according to the measures of hewed stones, sawed with saws, within and without, even from the foundation unto the coping, and \add so\add* on the outside toward the great court.
And the foundation \add was of\add* costly stones, \add even\add* great stones, stones of ten cubits, and stones of eight cubits.
And above \add were\add* costly stones, after the measures of hewed stones, and cedars.

And the great court round about \add was with\add* three rows \add of\add* hewed stones, and a row of cedar beams, both for the inner court of the house of the \sc Lord\sc*, and for the porch of the house.
And king Solomon sent and fet Hiram out of Tyre.

He \add was\add* a widow’s son of the tribe of Naphtali, and his father \add was\add* a man of Tyre, a worker in brass: and he was filled \add with\add* wisdom, and understanding, and cunning to work all works in brass. And he came to king Solomon, and wrought all his work.
For he cast two pillars \add of\add* brass, of eighteen cubits high apiece: and a line of twelve cubits did compass either of them about.

And he made two chapiters \add of\add* molten brass, to set upon the tops of the pillars: the height of the one chapiter \add was\add* five cubits, and the height of the other chapiter \add was\add* five cubits:

\add and\add* nets of checker work, \add and\add* wreaths of chain work, for the chapiters which \add were\add* upon the top of the pillars; seven for the one chapiter, and seven for the other chapiter.
And he made the pillars, and two rows round about upon the one network, to cover the chapiters that \add were\add* upon the top, \add with\add* pomegranates: and so did he for the other chapiter.
(And the chapiters that \add were\add* upon the top of the pillars \add were\add* of lily work in the porch, four cubits).

And the chapiters upon the two pillars \add had pomegranates\add* also above, over against the belly which \add was\add* by the network: and the pomegranates \add were\add* two hundred \add in\add* rows round about upon the other chapiter.
And he set up the pillars in the porch of the temple: and he set up the right pillar, and called the name thereof Jachin: and he set up the left pillar, and called the name thereof Boaz.
And upon the top of the pillars \add was\add* lily work: so was the work of the pillars finished.

And he made a molten sea, ten cubits from the one brim to the other: \add it was\add* round all about, and his height \add was\add* five cubits: and a line of thirty cubits did compass it round about.
And under the brim of it round about \add there were\add* knops compassing it, ten in a cubit, compassing the sea round about: the knops \add were\add* cast \add in\add* two rows, when it was cast.

It stood upon twelve oxen, three looking toward the north, and three looking toward the west, and three looking toward the south, and three looking toward the east: and the sea \add was set\add* above upon them, and all their hinder parts \add were\add* inward.
And it \add was\add* a handbreadth thick, and the brim thereof was wrought like the brim of a cup, \add with\add* flowers of lilies: it contained two thousand baths.
And he made ten bases of brass; four cubits \add was\add* the length of one base, and four cubits the breadth thereof, and three cubits the height of it.
And the work of the bases \add was on\add* this \add manner:\add* they had borders, and the borders \add were\add* between the ledges:

and on the borders that \add were\add* between the ledges \add were\add* lions, oxen, and cherubims: and upon the ledges \add there was\add* a base above: and beneath the lions and oxen \add were certain\add* additions made of thin work.
And every base had four brasen wheels, and plates of brass: and the four corners thereof had undersetters: under the laver \add were\add* undersetters molten, at the side of every addition.

And the mouth of it within the chapiter and above \add was\add* a cubit: but the mouth thereof \add was\add* round \add after\add* the work of the base, a cubit and a half: and also upon the mouth of it \add were\add* gravings with their borders, foursquare, not round.
And under the borders \add were\add* four wheels; and the axletrees of the wheels \add were\add* joined to the base: and the height of a wheel \add was\add* a cubit and half a cubit.
And the work of the wheels \add was\add* like the work of a chariot wheel: their axletrees, and their naves, and their felloes, and their spokes, \add were\add* all molten.
And \add there were\add* four undersetters to the four corners of one base: \add and\add* the undersetters \add were\add* of the \add very\add* base itself.
And in the top of the base \add was there\add* a round compass of half a cubit high: and on the top of the base the ledges thereof and the borders thereof \add were\add* of the same.
For on the plates of the ledges thereof, and on the borders thereof, he graved cherubims, lions, and palm trees, according to the proportion of every one, and additions round about.
After this \add manner\add* he made the ten bases: all of them had one casting, one measure, \add and\add* one size.
Then made he ten lavers of brass: one laver contained forty baths: \add and\add* every laver was four cubits: \add and\add* upon every one of the ten bases one laver.
And he put five bases on the right side of the house, and five on the left side of the house: and he set the sea on the right side of the house eastward over against the south.
And Hiram made the lavers, and the shovels, and the basons. So Hiram made an end of doing all the work that he made king Solomon \add for\add* the house of the \sc Lord\sc*:

the two pillars, and the two bowls of the chapiters that \add were\add* on the top of the \add two\add* pillars; and the two networks, to cover the two bowls of the chapiters which \add were\add* upon the top of the pillars;
and four hundred pomegranates for the two networks, \add even\add* two rows \add of\add* pomegranates for one network, to cover the two bowls of the chapiters that \add were\add* upon the pillars;
and the ten bases, and ten lavers on the bases;
and one sea, and twelve oxen under the sea;
and the pots, and the shovels, and the basons: and all these vessels, which Hiram made to king Solomon \add for\add* the house of the \sc Lord\sc*, \add were of\add* bright brass.
In the plain of Jordan did the king cast them, in the clay ground between Succoth and Zarthan.
And Solomon left all the vessels \add unweighed\add*, because they were exceeding many: neither was the weight of the brass found out.
And Solomon made all the vessels that \add pertained unto\add* the house of the \sc Lord\sc*: the altar of gold, and the table \add of\add* gold, whereupon the shewbread \add was\add*,
and the candlesticks \add of\add* pure gold, five on the right side, and five on the left, before the oracle, with the flowers, and the lamps, and the tongs \add of\add* gold,

and the bowls, and the snuffers, and the basons, and the spoons, and the censers \add of\add* pure gold; and the hinges \add of\add* gold, \add both\add* for the doors of the inner house, the most holy \add place, and\add* for the doors of the house, \add to wit\add*, of the temple.

So was ended all the work that king Solomon made \add for\add* the house of the \sc Lord\sc*. And Solomon brought in the \add things\add* which David his father had dedicated; \add even\add* the silver, and the gold, and the vessels, did he put among the treasures of the house of the \sc Lord\sc*.
